duties_responsibilities.duty: Engage individuals in a welcoming, hopeful, empathic manner regardless of disability or phase of recovery.
Screen for co-occurring disorders and recognize diagnostic criteria used to identify substance abuse or dependency.
Assess and evaluate the needs of individuals and develop stage wise treatment matched person-centered plans.
Complete referral forms, clinical and legal documentation, and collaborate with community partners for obtaining services.
Advocate, provide options for supports and services, and develop community resources to meet individual needs.
Educate individuals and provide resources for Self Determination options.
Assist individuals with identifying changes in behavior, attitude, feelings, and thoughts that are triggers for relapse.
Assist in the development of a relapse prevention plan and crisis plan utilizing a variety of supports.
Provide case management services for individuals, families, and/or guardians for support, rehabilitation, and crisis intervention purposes.
Monitor and evaluate living situations, school and program placements of individuals to determine consistency of treatment and progress.
Assist in commitment procedures when necessary as well as voluntary admissions.
Provide education on self-help options such as 12 Step programs, Dual Recovery, and other peer support groups.

education_certification.credential: Must be a QMHP in accordance with Medicaid Provider Manual Guidelines and meet specified degree requirements
